in the hilly area near the
mountains, Slănic is a spa town known for its salt mines and lakes.
(40 minutes - one hour travel time) and several daily buses from Bucharest (two hours and half); some of their schedules are available on

Slanic is reached by a railway, but trains can't actually enter the town because of a damaged bridge; instead they stop about 10 km away in Poiana Slănic (which is linked with Slănic itself by minibus) . There are three-four commuter trains daily from Ploieşti (50 minutes travel time), timetables are available on the rail operator CFR website
The town can be visited on foot.

value: content=Impressively large galleries of the old salt mines with a museum, a sort of art gallery, playgrounds for children, medical treatment areas etc.

Accommodations are available in several guesthouses with prices starting around €12/night.
